key_risks: Legal and financial risks from ongoing litigation and false claims allegations
Supply chain disruptions and increased costs
Economic sensitivity to industrial and business capital spending
Competitive pressures in the MRO industry
controversies: Paid $70 million to resolve false claims allegations under government contracts
Involved in multiple legal disputes, including W.W. Grainger Inc. v. Witz and supply chain management disputes
environmental_issues: Commitment to reducing energy emissions and environmental impact through optimized supply chains and waste reduction
social_issues: Strong human rights principles, including zero-tolerance for child or forced labor
Commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion
governance_issues: Robust business conduct guidelines focusing on ethical sourcing and responsible supply chain practices

sources.title: Illinois-based Hardware Distributor W.W. Grainger Pays US
sources.snippet: W.W. Grainger Inc. has agreed to pay the United States $70 million to resolve allegations that it submitted false claims under contracts with the General Services Administration (GSA) and the U.S. Postal Services (USPS), the Department of Justice announced today. Grainger is a national hardware distributor headquartered in Lake Forest, Illinois.
